Articles.Content:
In 0.23 I tried to see how much weight I could lift to orbit, culminating in a 1200t payload lifter at nearly 3000 parts. With the new parts, I'm aiming for low part counts.

Here's my first offering, a 640t payload lifter at only 170 parts with a ~16% payload ratio. It has a probe core, generator and RCS to de-orbit itself and nose cones to look fresh. If the payload has no reaction wheels, you will need to apply a bit of throttle to maneuver it for the circularization burn (it has RCS but 6 ports aren't enough to turn it very quickly). Or you can always add some reaction wheels to the lifter yourself. You can even remove all the extras to get it down to 124 parts (over 5t payload per part, booyah!).

The payload here is just a generic refueling station at exactly 640.00t (if you notice the strange configuration of junior docking ports, that's why).

Downloads

Subassembly: Lifter 64 Mk 03.craft

w/ Refueling Station (Action group 1 toggles solar arrays): Lifter 64 Mk 03 (Stock).craft
